author: Special Correspondent
text:
Private candidates who have applied to appear for the Plus Two examinations in March 2016 can download their hall tickets online.

The candidates can download the hall tickets from the websitewww.tndge.infrom January 30 to February 1.

The candidates can access the link ‘Higher secondary exam March 2016-Private Candidate-Hall Ticket Print Out” at the website and download the hall tickets by providing their application number and date of birth, V. Murugan, Regional Deputy Director of Government Examinations, Tiruchi, said in a release.

Candidates would not be allowed to sit for the examinations without hall tickets.

Candidates who have scored less than 40 in the practical examinations have to reappear for the same and sit for the theory paper, he added.

Tatkal scheme

Private candidates who wish to apply under the tatkal scheme to appear for the Plus Two exams to be held in March 2016 should apply online through the service centres set up in the respective districts between February 2 and 4.

The prescribed application fee should be paid in cash at the centres.

Applications filed through private browsing centres will not be entertained, Mr. Murugan added.

Details of the service centres are available on the website www.tndge.in
title: Plus Two hall tickets for private candidates
